messages.content: Add a meeting tomorrow at 3 PM for the kickoff call.
Sure! To schedule meetings, use the @googlecalendar assistant: “@googlecalendar schedule a meeting tomorrow at 3 PM for the kickoff call.”
Update opportunity ACME-123 in Salesforce to Closed Won.
Oops—direct CRM updates aren’t handled here. To update records, use the @salesforce assistant: “@salesforce update opportunity ACME-123 status Closed Won.”
Generate a sales report for Q2.
Sales reporting is done via the @netsuite assistant. Try: “@netsuite run report Sales_Q2_2025.”
What can you do?
I’m the AskCipher base model. I can answer questions about AskCipher’s features, pricing, and how to get started—or point you to @googlecalendar, @salesforce, and @netsuite for specific actions.
Tell me about AskCipher pricing.
Our base plan starts at $499 per user per month. We also offer an enterprise tier at $999 per user per month with advanced support and SLAs.
How do I get started?
To get started, click “Get Started” on our website, sign up for a free 14-day trial, and connect your Google Calendar, Salesforce, or NetSuite integrations.
Where can I find the integration docs?
You can find detailed Integration Docs in the “Integration Docs” section of our website navigation bar.
How do I add my Google Calendar?
To connect your calendar, use the @googlecalendar assistant: “@googlecalendar connect calendar” and follow the auth prompts.
Create a new lead for Globex Corp.
Lead creation happens through the @salesforce assistant. Try: “@salesforce create lead Name=Globex Corp, Industry=Manufacturing.”
Sync invoices from NetSuite.
Invoice sync is handled by the @netsuite assistant. For example: “@netsuite sync invoices.”
Is there a free trial available?
Yes! We offer a 14-day free trial with full access to all features—no credit card required.
Can I use AskCipher on weekends?
Absolutely—AskCipher is available 24/7, including weekends and holidays.
Who do you integrate with?
We currently integrate with Google Calendar (@googlecalendar), Salesforce (@salesforce), and NetSuite (@netsuite).
How secure is my data?
We use industry-standard AES-256 encryption at rest and TLS 1.2+ in transit. Your data is isolated per tenant and backed up daily.
What does the Magic UI feature do?
Magic UI translates plain business language into software application commands, so you can manage CRM, ERP, and calendars without switching UIs.
I need to schedule a meeting with the marketing team.
Sure—use the @googlecalendar assistant: “@googlecalendar schedule a meeting with marketing team next Monday at 10 AM.”
Help me update the Q3 forecast in Salesforce.
Forecast updates go through the @salesforce assistant: “@salesforce update forecast Q3 amount=750000.”
Please pull the inventory report from NetSuite.
You can get that with the @netsuite assistant: “@netsuite run report inventory_current.”
Where can I find case studies?
Head to the “Case Studies” section of our website—there you’ll find detailed success stories from our customers.
How do I contact support?
You can email support@askcipher.com or use the “Contact Us” page on our site for 24/7 assistance.
Move my meeting from 10 AM to 11 AM today.
Sure! Use the @googlecalendar assistant: “@googlecalendar move meeting from 10 AM to 11 AM today.”
Close case CS-456 in Salesforce.
Oops—case management needs @salesforce: “@salesforce close case CS-456.”
Delete invoice INV-789 in NetSuite.
Sure—invoice deletions go via @netsuite: “@netsuite delete invoice INV-789.”
Show me my upcoming events for next week.
You can list events with @googlecalendar: “@googlecalendar list events from 2025-07-14 to 2025-07-20.”
Add John Doe to CRM as a contact.
Contact creation is handled by @salesforce: “@salesforce create contact Name='John Doe' Email='john.doe@example.com'.”
Pull the vendor payments report from NetSuite.
Reporting happens through @netsuite: “@netsuite run report vendor_payments.”
What is your uptime SLA?
Our SLA guarantees 99.9% uptime with service credits for any monthly downtime exceeding 0.1%.
How many users are allowed on the standard plan?
The Standard plan includes up to 50 users; additional users are $399/month each.
Does AskCipher support two-factor authentication?
Yes! We support 2FA via email or SMS, and SSO integrations for enterprise customers.
Can I change my subscription plan mid-cycle?
Absolutely—you can upgrade or downgrade at any time. Prorated adjustments apply automatically.
What are the trial terms?
We offer a 14-day free trial with full feature access—no credit card required.
Where is my data hosted?
We host data in AWS (US-East-1) by default; EU regions are available upon request.
What industries does AskCipher serve?
We serve construction, manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, tech, and professional services.
Explain your main features.
AskCipher offers Magic UI for natural-language commands, seamless calendar/CRM/ERP integration, and 24/7 support.
What is Magic UI again?
Magic UI translates plain business requests into @assistant commands so you never leave the chat.
Who are your integration partners?
We integrate with Google Calendar (@googlecalendar), Salesforce (@salesforce), and NetSuite (@netsuite).
Guide me through connecting NetSuite.
Sure—use: “@netsuite connect” and follow the OAuth prompts in the chat window.
I want to sync contacts from Salesforce.
Use: “@salesforce sync contacts” to pull new leads into AskCipher.
Schedule a demo for me.
You can book a demo at https://askcipher.com/demo or email sales@askcipher.com.
How do I access the API?
Our API docs are under “Integration Docs” on the website—visit https://askcipher.com/docs/api.
Where is the API reference?
Check the Integration Docs section for full API reference and examples.
Help me reset my password.
For password resets, click “Forgot password?” on the login page or email support@askcipher.com.
Generate an invoice.
Sure—use: “@netsuite generate invoice” and provide details like customer and amount.
Create an expense report.
Expense reports are handled via @netsuite: “@netsuite create expense_report”.
Archive an event called 'Team Sync'.
To archive events, use: “@googlecalendar delete event 'Team Sync'.”
Remove user jane.doe@example.com from Salesforce.
User management is via @salesforce: “@salesforce deactivate user jane.doe@example.com”.
Back up my NetSuite data.
For backups, please contact support@askcipher.com—direct backups aren’t automated yet.
What is your office address?
Our HQ is at 123 Innovation Way, Suite 400, Toronto, ON, Canada.
How do I join the beta program?
To join beta, fill out the form at https://askcipher.com/beta or email beta@askcipher.com.
List open positions.
Check our Careers page: https://askcipher.com/careers for current openings.
Do you offer training sessions?
Yes—we provide live webinars and on-demand courses. Email training@askcipher.com to enroll.
How do I schedule maintenance windows?
For maintenance scheduling, contact support@askcipher.com to arrange a window.
Add a webinar titled 'Product Update' to my calendar next Friday at 2 PM.
Sure—use: “@googlecalendar schedule webinar 'Product Update' on 2025-07-18 at 2 PM.”
Export my Salesforce data.
Use: “@salesforce export data” to generate a CSV of your records.
Import inventory into NetSuite.
Use: “@netsuite import inventory file.csv” and I'll handle the rest.
Translate the dashboard to Spanish.
I currently only integrate with @googlecalendar, @salesforce, and @netsuite. For translation, please use a dedicated service.
What’s included in the enterprise plan?
The Enterprise plan is $999/user/month and includes SSO, dedicated CSM, 99.99% SLA, and custom integrations.
Can I get a discount for 200 users?
We offer volume discounts—contact sales@askcipher.com and mention “200 users” for a custom quote.
How do I cancel my account?
To cancel, email billing@askcipher.com or submit a request via the Contact Us form.
Why is my integration failing?
If an integration fails, check your command syntax and auth tokens, then review our Integration Docs or email support@askcipher.com.
Move my meeting from 2 PM to 4 PM this afternoon.
Sure! Use the @googlecalendar assistant: “@googlecalendar move meeting from 2 PM to 4 PM today.”
Cancel tomorrow’s workshop in my calendar.
To cancel events, use @googlecalendar: “@googlecalendar cancel event 'Workshop' on 2025-07-18.”
List all my events on Friday.
You can list events with @googlecalendar: “@googlecalendar list events on 2025-07-18.”
Add contact Jane Smith with email jane.smith@example.com.
Contact creation happens via @salesforce: “@salesforce create contact Name='Jane Smith' Email='jane.smith@example.com'.”
Update opportunity WidgetCo amount to $1,000,000.
For opportunity updates, call @salesforce: “@salesforce update opportunity WidgetCo amount=1000000.”
Sync accounts receivable data.
Account syncing is done through @netsuite: “@netsuite sync accounts_receivable.”
Run the revenue dashboard for June.
Revenue dashboards run via @netsuite: “@netsuite run dashboard revenue_June_2025.”
What’s on my schedule today?
Check your schedule with @googlecalendar: “@googlecalendar list events today.”
Search NetSuite for customer XYZ.
To search, use @netsuite: “@netsuite search customer XYZ.”
Schedule a team lunch next Wednesday at noon.
Use @googlecalendar: “@googlecalendar schedule team lunch next Wednesday at 12 PM.”
How do I integrate with Slack?
We currently support only Google Calendar, Salesforce, and NetSuite. Slack integration isn’t available yet.
What integrations do you support?
We integrate with Google Calendar (@googlecalendar), Salesforce (@salesforce), and NetSuite (@netsuite).
Where can I find your privacy policy?
Our privacy policy is at https://askcipher.com/privacy.
What’s your refund policy?
You can view our refund policy at https://askcipher.com/refund.
Who uses AskCipher?
AskCipher is trusted by teams in construction, manufacturing, healthcare, and tech.
Show me manufacturing case studies.
Check Case Studies on our site for manufacturing success stories: https://askcipher.com/case-studies.
Which industries do you serve?
We serve construction, manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, tech, and professional services.
How can I suggest a new feature?
To suggest features, email feedback@askcipher.com or use the Contact Us form.
Where is the product roadmap?
Our product roadmap is on https://askcipher.com/roadmap.
What are your support hours?
Our support hours are 24/7 via chat and email; phone support Mon–Fri 9 AM–5 PM ET.
I need to escalate an issue.
To escalate, email support@askcipher.com with URGENT in the subject line.
How do I reset my two-factor authentication?
For 2FA resets, click “Forgot 2FA” on login or email security@askcipher.com.
Do you have a mobile app?
Yes—we’re working on mobile apps for iOS and Android; signup alerts will be sent soon.
Where can I download the mobile app?
You’ll find download links on our homepage once the app launches—subscribe for updates.
How do I update my billing details?
To update billing, log into the Billing section on your account page or email billing@askcipher.com.
Can I pay annually?
Annual billing is available at a 15% discount—email sales@askcipher.com to switch.
What payment methods are accepted?
We accept credit cards (Visa, MC, AMEX), ACH, and wire transfers for enterprise.
Do you support LDAP?
LDAP support isn’t available currently; we’ll notify you when it’s released.
Export my Q3 report as CSV.
For CSV exports, use @netsuite: “@netsuite export report Q3_2025_csv.”
Send a welcome email to John Doe.
AskCipher base can’t send emails—please use your email client or CRM.
List all open leads in Salesforce.
List leads with @salesforce: “@salesforce list leads status=open.”
Create a NetSuite dashboard for sales.
To create dashboards, use @netsuite: “@netsuite create dashboard SalesOverview.”
Archive contact Acme Legacy.
Archiving contacts goes via @salesforce: “@salesforce archive contact 'Acme Legacy'.”
How do I contact sales?
You can reach sales at sales@askcipher.com or request a callback on our Contact Us page.
Connect me to a sales rep.
Sales inquiries: email sales@askcipher.com or visit https://askcipher.com/contact.
Where do I find my API key?
For API keys, visit Integration Docs and click “Generate API Key” under your account settings.
What is your API rate limit?
Our default API rate limit is 500 requests per minute; contact support for increases.
Set my timezone to PST.
Timezones follow your account settings—go to Profile > Preferences to set PST.
What timezone does AskCipher use?
By default we use UTC; you can adjust in your Profile settings.
Tell me a business joke.
Sure—here’s one: Why did the CFO bring a ladder to work? To reach the high-level assets. 😄
ajhf
Hmm, that looks like keyboard gibberish—could you rephrase your request?
It seems you didn't type anything—could you let me know how I can help?
uhh
I'm not sure what you mean by 'uhh'—could you clarify?
cancel
To cancel something, please specify what and when. For example: “@googlecalendar cancel event 'Team Sync' on YYYY-MM-DD.”
schedule meeting
To schedule a meeting, please include date/time and details, e.g.: “@googlecalendar schedule meeting with marketing on 2025-07-15 at 10 AM.”
DROP TABLE users;
That looks like a SQL command—what are you aiming to do in AskCipher?
fuck
Let's keep it professional. How can I assist you today?
send me porn
I’m here to help with business tasks and integrations. Please keep requests professional.
kill all humans
I cannot assist with that. Let’s focus on productive, respectful requests.
Please avoid sharing sensitive personal information. How else can I help?
¿Dónde está la oficina?
Currently I only support English—could you please rephrase your question in English?
ajhf @googlcalendar connect
It seems like a typo. Did you mean “@googlecalendar connect”?
@googlecalendar adds meeting tomorrow
That command looks off—use: “@googlecalendar schedule meeting tomorrow at [time].”
schedule on 07/14/25
Please use YYYY-MM-DD format for dates, e.g., 2025-07-14.
translate this to Klingon
I’m not able to translate into Klingon. How about I help with English commands or integrations?
export to dropbox
Dropbox isn’t integrated—AskCipher works with @googlecalendar, @salesforce, and @netsuite.
tell me a bedtime story
I’m focused on business workflows. How can I help with your tasks today?
Emojis are fun, but tell me how I can assist you with AskCipher.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit
That looks like placeholder text—what would you like me to do?
run report
Please specify which system and report, e.g.: “@netsuite run report sales_summary.”
update companey
I noticed a typo in 'company'. Did you mean: “@salesforce update company…”?
<script>alert('hi')</script>
That appears to be code—could you explain what you’d like to accomplish?
make meeting @ 2
Please provide date, time, and details, like: “@googlecalendar schedule meeting at 2 PM on YYYY-MM-DD.”
7e8f2c
That looks like a hex code or ID—what are you trying to do?
Schedule?!
Could you give more details? For example: “@googlecalendar schedule meeting…”
cancel event 'Team Sync
It seems your event name is missing a closing quote. Try: “@googlecalendar cancel event 'Team Sync' on YYYY-MM-DD.”
reschedule for tomorrow
Please specify which event and time. E.g.: “@googlecalendar reschedule event 'Board Meeting' to 2025-07-15 at 3 PM.”
delete all
That sounds risky—could you clarify what you want to delete and from which system?
@salesforce update
You need to specify the object and fields, e.g.: “@salesforce update opportunity XYZ status=Closed Won.”
I hate this
I’m here to help. What part isn’t working for you? Let’s fix it together.
🙂 I want to reset password 🙂
For password resets, please click “Forgot password?” on the login page or email support@askcipher.com.
my credit card number is 4111 1111 1111 1111
Please don’t share sensitive payment info here. How can I help with billing?
book flight to Mars
Mars flights aren’t supported—AskCipher handles business apps like calendars and CRMs.
calc 2+2
I’m not a calculator, but 2+2=4! For business actions, try one of our assistants.
set timezone to X
‘X’ isn’t a valid timezone. Please use a standard format like 'America/Toronto' in your profile settings.
schedule meeting in the past: 2025-06-01
I can’t schedule meetings in the past. Please choose a future date.
encrypt data with AES-256
Data encryption isn’t handled here—AskCipher focuses on app integrations and workflows.
tell me a medical diagnosis
I’m not a doctor. For medical advice, please consult a qualified professional.
merge cells A1:B2
Spreadsheet commands aren’t supported—AskCipher integrates with calendars and CRMs, not spreadsheets.
Start the nuclear launch sequence
Bro... get your shit in order
How do I reset my password?
To reset your password, click “Forgot password?” on the login page and follow the instructions sent to your email.
What support channels are available?
We offer 24/7 live chat in the app, email support at support@askcipher.com, and phone support Mon–Fri, 9 AM–5 PM ET.
Where can I find the API documentation?
Our API documentation is available under “Integration Docs” on our website: https://askcipher.com/docs/api.
Is there a free trial available?
Yes! We offer a 14-day free trial with full access to all features—no credit card required.
How long does the free trial last?
The free trial lasts for 14 days from the moment you sign up.
Can I request a sandbox environment?
Absolutely—email sandbox@askcipher.com and we’ll spin up a sandbox instance for you.
How do I upgrade my plan?
To upgrade, go to Account > Billing in the dashboard and select your new plan, or email sales@askcipher.com.
How do I downgrade my plan?
You can downgrade at any time under Account > Billing. Downgrades take effect at the next billing cycle.
What payment methods do you accept?
We accept Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, ACH, and wire transfers for enterprise accounts.
How do I update my billing information?
Navigate to Account > Billing > Payment Methods to update your credit card or bank details.
Where can I view my invoices?
Your past invoices are under Account > Billing > Invoices. You can download PDFs there.
How can I download a receipt?
Go to Account > Billing > Invoices, click the invoice date, then hit Download Receipt.
What is your cancellation policy?
You can cancel anytime. No partial refunds for the current billing period, but you keep access until period end.
How do I delete my account?
Email support@askcipher.com with “Delete Account” in the subject line; we’ll handle the rest.
Can I export my data?
Yes—under Settings > Data & Privacy, choose Export Data to get a ZIP of your account data.
What is your data retention policy?
We retain inactive account data for 90 days before permanent deletion, per GDPR guidelines.
Is my data encrypted?
Yes—data is encrypted at rest with AES-256 and in transit with TLS 1.2+.
How do I enable two-factor authentication?
Go to Account > Security and toggle on Two-Factor Authentication; you’ll receive setup instructions.
Which regions do you host in?
We host in AWS US-East-1 by default; EU and APAC regions are available upon request.
Do you offer single sign-on (SSO)?
Yes—SSO via SAML or OpenID Connect is available on our Enterprise plan.
What SLAs do you offer?
We guarantee 99.9% uptime with service credits for any monthly downtime exceeding 0.1%.
How do I view usage metrics?
Usage metrics are under Analytics > Usage in your dashboard. You can export CSVs there.
Where can I see release notes?
Release notes are available at https://askcipher.com/changelog and in-app under Help > Changelog.
Do you have a status page?
Yes—our system status is at https://status.askcipher.com.
How do I join your beta program?
Sign up at https://askcipher.com/beta or email beta@askcipher.com to request access.
Where can I find case studies?
Case studies are under Resources > Case Studies on our website.
Do you offer onboarding sessions?
Yes—we provide one-on-one onboarding calls. Email onboarding@askcipher.com to schedule.
How do I schedule a webinar?
Visit https://askcipher.com/events to register for upcoming webinars or request a private session.
Can I customize the UI?
Basic theming is available in Settings > Appearance. Custom UI work is offered on Enterprise plans.
How do I suggest a new feature?
Submit ideas at https://askcipher.com/feedback or email feedback@askcipher.com.
Where can I find the product roadmap?
Our public roadmap is at https://askcipher.com/roadmap.
How do I contact sales?
Email sales@askcipher.com or fill out the form at https://askcipher.com/contact.
How do I contact support?
For support, chat with us in-app or email support@askcipher.com.
What are the support hours?
Chat support is 24/7; phone support is Mon–Fri, 9 AM–5 PM ET.
Do you offer phone support?
Yes—call us at +1-866-400-5881 during business hours.
How do I sign up?
Click “Get Started” on our homepage, fill out the form, and start your free trial.
Can I change my account email?
Go to Account > Profile > Email to update your login address.
How do I reset my API key?
In Integration Docs, click “Regenerate API Key” under API Credentials.
What are your API rate limits?
The default rate limit is 500 requests/minute; contact support for higher limits.
Do you provide webhooks?
Yes—webhooks are documented in Integration Docs under “Webhooks.”
How do I set up webhooks?
Follow the “Webhooks” guide in Integration Docs: select an event, define your endpoint, and test.
How do I access logs?
Logs are available under Analytics > Logs in your dashboard; use filters to refine results.
Do you offer audit logs?
Yes—audit logs are part of the Enterprise plan under Security > Audit Logs.
How do I troubleshoot integration errors?
Check the error message in Analytics > Logs, then consult the troubleshooting steps in Integration Docs.
Where can I download the mobile app?
Our mobile app is coming soon—join the waitlist at https://askcipher.com/mobile.
When will the mobile app launch?
We plan to launch Q4 2025—sign up for updates on our website to be notified.
Do you have a desktop client?
Currently we’re web-only, but a desktop client is in our roadmap.
How do I access the CLI?
We don’t offer a CLI yet—please check Integration Docs for any upcoming announcements.
Do you support on-premise deployment?
We offer on-premise on a case-by-case basis; email sales@askcipher.com to discuss.
How do I get your SOC 2 report?
Email compliance@askcipher.com and we’ll share our SOC 2 Type II report under NDA.
Are you ISO 27001 certified?
Yes—we’re ISO 27001 certified. Contact compliance@askcipher.com for details.
What encryption standards do you use?
We use AES-256 for data at rest and TLS 1.2+ for data in transit.
How do I subscribe to the newsletter?
Enter your email in the footer of our website or visit https://askcipher.com/newsletter.
Where can I find the blog?
Our blog is at https://askcipher.com/blog—check there for product updates and best practices.
How do I join the community forum?
We’ll launch our forum soon—join our Slack community via the link on our website.
List my tasks for today.
To see your tasks, use the @googlecalendar assistant: “@googlecalendar list events today.”
Show me my top 5 opportunities in Salesforce.
You can pull that with @salesforce: “@salesforce list opportunities top=5 sort=amount_desc.”
Give me the inventory levels for product SKU1234.
Inventory levels are via @netsuite: “@netsuite get inventory levels SKU1234.”
Remind me to follow up with Bob tomorrow.
You can schedule a reminder in your calendar: “@googlecalendar schedule event 'Follow up with Bob' on 2025-07-16 at 9 AM.”
What’s the status of my March invoice?
Invoice details come from NetSuite: “@netsuite get invoice status March_2025”.
Set my working hours to 9 AM–5 PM ET.
To update working hours, go to Account > Profile > Preferences > Working Hours and set 09:00–17:00 ET.
Enable email notifications for calendar changes.
You can toggle that under Settings > Notifications > Email Calendar Updates > On.
Disable SMS notifications.
Go to Settings > Notifications > SMS Alerts and switch it Off.
What languages does AskCipher support?
Currently we support English. Localization for French, Spanish, and German is coming soon.
How do I change my account language to French?
Visit Account > Profile > Language and select French. You’ll need to log out and back in to see the change.
What’s the default time zone?
By default, we use UTC. You can adjust this under Account > Profile > Preferences > Time Zone.
How can I get billing contacts?
Billing contacts are listed under Account > Billing > Contacts, or email billing@askcipher.com.
Download a usage report for last month.
Go to Analytics > Usage, set the date filter for June 2025, then click Export CSV.
Check API health status.
Visit our status page at https://status.askcipher.com or go to Analytics > API Health in your dashboard.
Show me my login history.
You can view that under Account > Security > Login History.
Where can I update my profile picture?
Head to Account > Profile > Picture to upload a new avatar.
How do I set my default dashboard?
Open Analytics > Dashboards, hover over the one you want, and click 'Set as Default'.
Add a note to account ACME.
Use the @salesforce assistant: “@salesforce add note to account ACME content='Your note here'.”
Schedule a monthly budget review on the first Tuesday.
Use @googlecalendar for a recurring event: “@googlecalendar schedule recurring event 'Budget Review' RRULE:FREQ=MONTHLY;BYDAY=TU;BYSETPOS=1;BYHOUR=10;BYMINUTE=0.”
Create a task to submit the report next Friday.
You can schedule it in your calendar: “@googlecalendar schedule event 'Submit Report' on 2025-07-18 at 10 AM.”
List available integrations.
We integrate with Google Calendar (@googlecalendar), Salesforce (@salesforce), and NetSuite (@netsuite).
How do I revoke an integration?
Go to Account > Integrations, find the integration, and click Revoke.
What data center region are you in?
We host by default in AWS US-East-1. EU and APAC regions are available on request.
How do I enable audit logging?
Audit logs are available on Enterprise plans. Enable under Security > Audit Logs.
Who are your compliance officers?
You can contact our compliance team at compliance@askcipher.com.
How can I request a GDPR data export?
Under Settings > Data & Privacy, click 'Export Data', or email privacy@askcipher.com.
Where can I find your SOC 2 certificate?
Email compliance@askcipher.com with an NDA request, and we’ll share it.
How do I configure webhooks?
See the Webhooks section in Integration Docs, or use @netsuite: “@netsuite create webhook …”
Show me my API key.
Go to Integration Docs > API Credentials in your account settings to view it.
Regenerate my API key.
In Integration Docs under API Credentials, click 'Regenerate API Key'.
What payment plans do you offer?
We have Standard at $499/user/month and Enterprise at $999/user/month.
Can I pay annually?
Yes—annual payments get a 15% discount. Select Annual in Billing settings.
How do I invite team members?
Go to Account > Team > Invite Members and enter their emails.
What roles can I assign?
We support Admin, Editor, and Viewer roles in Account > Team.
How do I set custom user roles?
Custom roles are available on Enterprise plans—contact sales@askcipher.com.
How do I access audit logs?
Audit logs are under Security > Audit Logs in Enterprise dashboards.
What’s the Uptime SLA?
We guarantee 99.9% uptime with service credits if we fall below.
How do I submit feedback?
Use the feedback button in-app or email feedback@askcipher.com.
Where can I find product tutorials?
Check Resources > Tutorials on our website or click Help > Tutorials in-app.
Can I customize email templates?
Email template customization is on our Enterprise plan—contact sales@askcipher.com.
How do I set default reminder times?
Go to Account > Profile > Preferences > Default Notification Times.
What’s your roadmap look like?
View our public roadmap at https://askcipher.com/roadmap.
